page.title: 04 OLD MINES
page.content: The three main localites for the mining operations were Stanton,Starwood and at the Tunnel shaft in Cotton Dell. In the summer of 1862 some good quantites of copper and lead ore were found in a shaft at Ribden, and some of the local copper ore was of very high quality. Mining for coal began in Starwod early in 1859, where they were trying to recover a seam less than 2 feet thick but work came to a standstill because of lack of air. The shaft has been filled with waste from the adjacent copper works but the level is still open in Cotton Dell. There is a small flow of water from the level and there are traces of iron ore deposits on the floor. A Miss Agnes Allen,aged about 90yrs,who now lives in Cheadl,can remember the men from Oakamoor digging up coal from the field by Owls Clough in the 1930's.
